summary: The Resilient Transit Act of 2025 amends Title 49 of the United States Code to authorize state of good repair grants for public transportation resilience improvement. It defines "resilience improvement," outlines eligible activities for grant funding, and specifies project types. The bill prioritizes projects that increase the resilience of public transportation systems against climate change impacts. It also requires annual reports to Congress detailing grant implementation and project outcomes, with an emphasis on projects benefiting underserved communities including environmental justice communities. The bill also amends funding authorizations to reflect the new grant program.
